p: Regarding oxidation, p‐AV values were consistently higher in DF, without differences between the two low‐fat processes. When the oils are compared within each process, OO had significantly lower p‐AV values, being, therefore, less oxidized, which could be a consequence of its higher phenolic content although its lower polyunsaturated degree also contributes for its stability. In the low‐fat processes, the p‐AV value was generally low, reducing the ability to distinguish the different oils, but SFO had higher amounts of secondary aldehydes.
